image.altText: Cooking on a gas stove

items.synopsis: Experts say getting households and businesses that can easily disconnect from gas is key to meeting emission reduction targets.

title.children: New home gas bans will lead to a 'death spiral', experts say

image.altText: Jana Pittman on Q+A

items.synopsis: As politicians are forced to hear their bickering on the Voice is confusing, the Q+A panel agrees that there should be extra funds allocated for paid parental leave.

title.children: 'Confusing message': Voice concerns laid bare on Q+A

image.altText: A smiling man wearing a suit embraces a woman wearing a football uniform

items.synopsis: Prosecutors in Spain launch an investigation into the country's football federation president Luis Rubiales, as the storm surrounding his kissing of player Jenni Hermoso intensifies.

title.children: Besieged Spanish soccer boss faces sex assault probe as his mother begins hunger strike

image.altText: Linda Burney, standing in front of a group of people, holds a press conference outside with gum trees behind her

items.synopsis: Australia's most senior Indigenous politician has broken her silence about her speech, having faced a campaign of whispers about her health.

title.children: 'My voice has changed': Linda Burney breaks silence amid whisper campaign

items.synopsis: Many of us are now dressed head to toe in plastic thanks to the invention of cheap and durable textiles like polyester. But the extent of the environmental impact from these garments might surprise you — we've tracked the life cycle of a polyester top from an oil field, through to when you chuck it in the bin.

title.children: Ever wondered what goes into making your polyester T-shirt?

image.altText: A large set of drones is pictured inside a big warehouse-like space.

items.synopsis: There are five key observations which can be made about drones from their use in the war in Ukraine. And the Australian Defence Force needs to take notice, writes Mick Ryan.

title.children: Drones are being used in the Russia-Ukraine conflict and Australia has a lot to learn

image.altText: Silhouette of two Russian women standing close with a Russian flag and a Ukrainian flag

items.synopsis: Katya and Sascha know that speaking out against the war is risky, but that's not stopping them.

title.children: Why Sascha is putting her life on the line to speak out against Russia's war on Ukraine

image.altText: A woman holding a TEMU bag

items.synopsis: A flashy new online shopping app has been bombarding Australians on social media. While some see it as the saviour of China's economy, not everyone is convinced.

title.children: Are you getting a lot of ads for TEMU? The Chinese retailer is coming for Amazon – and it might win

image.altText: A composite of Donald Trump's mugshot and the pope waving at a podium.

items.synopsis: This morning's news, as it happens.

title.children: Donald Trump threatens to 'appeal' trial date, Pope Francis criticised for praising Russian tsars. The latest news with The Loop

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: A woman has been bitten by a dingo on K'gari off the southern Queensland coast. The woman was standing by herself on the beach on the eastern side of the island when she was nipped by a collared dingo. Rangers say she turned around to find two animals circling her before one of the dingoes lunged again. The woman swung her water bottle and yelled to scare the dingoes away as four passing motorists came to her aid.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Woman circled by dingoes before K'gari attack

children.content: A woman has been bitten by a dingo on K'gari off the southern Queensland coast.
The woman was standing by herself on the beach on the eastern side of the island when she was nipped by a collared dingo.
Rangers say she turned around to find two animals circling her before one of the dingoes lunged again.
The woman swung her water bottle and yelled to scare the dingoes away as four passing motorists came to her aid.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Pope Francis is under fire for telling Russian young people to remember they are the heirs of past tsars such as Peter the Great. Ukraine says the comments were "deeply regrettable". The Pope read his prepared speech in Spanish but at the end, shifted into impromptu Italian and said: "Don't forget (your) heredity. You are heirs of the great Russia - the great Russia of the saints, of kings, the great Russia of Peter the Great, of Catherine II, the great Russian empire, cultured, so much culture, so much humanity. You are the heirs of the great mother Russia. Go forward." The Vatican released the text of the address but did not include the last, improvised paragraph.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Pope Francis to Russian teens: 'You are the heirs of the great mother Russia'

children.content: Pope Francis is under fire for telling Russian young people to remember they are the heirs of past tsars such as Peter the Great.
Ukraine says the comments were "deeply regrettable".
The Pope read his prepared speech in Spanish but at the end, shifted into impromptu Italian and said:

"Don't forget (your) heredity. You are heirs of the great Russia - the great Russia of the saints, of kings, the great Russia of Peter the Great, of Catherine II, the great Russian empire, cultured, so much culture, so much humanity. You are the heirs of the great mother Russia. Go forward."
The Vatican released the text of the address but did not include the last, improvised paragraph.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Donald Trump says he will appeal the scheduling of a March 2024 trial over his alleged efforts to subvert his 2020 election defeat. Legal experts say it's not possible. "I will APPEAL," the former president wrote in a post on his Truth Social platform. He did not say how or when the appeal would be made. A trial court's scheduling decision is not a legitimate basis for an appeal prior to a verdict being reached, according to legal experts.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Trump plans to appeal March 2024 trial date

children.content: Donald Trump says he will appeal the scheduling of a March 2024 trial over his alleged efforts to subvert his 2020 election defeat.
Legal experts say it's not possible.
"I will APPEAL," the former president wrote in a post on his Truth Social platform. He did not say how or when the appeal would be made.

props.alt: T-shirts and hats with an image depicting the mugshot of former President Donald Trump

children.content: A trial court's scheduling decision is not a legitimate basis for an appeal prior to a verdict being reached, according to legal experts.

image.altText: Close up of Qantas chief executive Alan Joyce speaking to the media at a press event.

items.synopsis: Qantas admits to having "around $100 million" in outstanding flight credits owed to Jetstar customers during a fiery Senate committee hearing in Melbourne where outgoing CEO Alan Joyce was accused of "misleading the Australian public".

title.children: Qantas admits to holding at least $470 million in unused flight credits from customers

image.altText: An older man with dark hair and thick rimmed square glasses waring a suit and tie looks ahead in front of Qantas logos.

items.synopsis: Instead of being praised for Qantas's financial health, Alan Joyce is under fire — and it's all to do with how much taxpayer support it received versus how much tax it paid, writes business editor Ian Verrender.

title.children: As Alan Joyce prepares to take flight from Qantas, taxpayers are left to foot the bill

image.altText: A large military aircraft hovering above water near the beach, with spectators below.

items.synopsis: Three US marines remain in the Royal Darwin Hospital after a US Osprey aircraft crashed on a remote Northern Territory island, claiming the lives of three personnel.

title.children: 'Significant fire': The chilling moments heard on air traffic control audio following the US Osprey crash

image.altText: Mother holding the wrist of a baby who is out of focus.

items.synopsis: A cultural review of Australia's prison system details harrowing accounts of women giving birth in custody, as a former inmate likens scenes to The Handmaid's Tale.

title.children: Prison 'the worst place' for mothers, former inmate says, 'because it's solely about punishment'

image.altText: Blonde woman in dark glasses and red lipstick looking into the camera with a park in the background

items.synopsis: The British activist has demanded opposition leader John Pesutto and his leadership team apologise and compensate her for false claims made against her.

title.children: Anti-trans rights activist Kellie-Jay Keen-Minshull threatens legal action against Victorian Liberal party

image.altText: A young man in a military uniform wearing medals stands with his Navy cap under his arm.

items.synopsis: A mother tells the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide her son was "in hospital dying" when he was medically discharged from the Navy against his will.

title.children: David Finney once appeared in an ad for the Navy. Two years after being medically discharged, he took his own life

image.altText: Woman takes selfie and smiles at camera

items.synopsis: From making space for more complainants to report, to supporting them from start to finish, here's what experts say the justice systems needs to do to better support victim-survivors of sexual assault.

title.children: Karen has been waiting nearly 20 years for justice. She says law reform is long overdue

image.altText: A view from the top of a ski run showing skiers on a small patch of snow with a resort in the distant, grassy hills behind.

items.synopsis: The sight of grassy slopes at Australia’s ski resorts this winter has been the stuff of nightmares for skiers, snowboarders and mountain lovers. As research shows how climate change could impact the future for Europe's ski resorts.

title.children: As Australian ski resorts suffer through a warm winter, there's a dire warning for Europe

image.altText: A teenage girl sits on a couch with a laptop.

items.synopsis: After battling drug abuse and homelessness as a teenager, secure housing has been a game-changer for 18-year-old Korrinne Muntelwit. But there's a dire need for more housing across the board for young people like her.

title.children: Korrine's getting her life on track, but she fears for other young people trying to escape homelessness

image.altText: Queensland Deputy Premier, Steven Miles looks on as Minister for Health, Shannon Fentiman speaks

items.synopsis: It was a striking image — two of Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk's potential successors stepping out together to fend off questions about the future of her leadership.

title.children: How serious are the Queensland Labor leadership rumblings about Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk?

image.altText: Headshots of a man in a suit and a blonde haired woman in side profile

items.synopsis: WA politician James Hayward is behind bars and has been automatically disqualified from parliament after being found guilty of sexually abusing a girl in the state's South West.

title.children: MP disqualified from parliament, facing jail term after guilty verdicts in child sexual abuse case

image.altText: A black and white photo of Richard Milgin

items.synopsis: A WA coroner says Richard Milgin's disappearance from a remote Kimberley community will remain unsolved unless someone comes forward with new information.

title.children: Inquest closes with no answers to 30-year mystery of man's disappearance after 'wrong skin' relationship

image.altText: A natural waterhole surrounded by rocks and trees with a small waterfall

items.synopsis: Police confirm a bone found by a tourist on the riverbed is human and divers will continue to search Mossman Gorge.

title.children: Human bone found in popular swimming spot could be from missing woman

image.altText: A traveller walks through the international flight arrivals area at Beijing Capital International Airport.

items.synopsis: Following it's three-year isolation China will finally lift the last of it's controversial 'zero COVID' measures.

title.children: China set to lift negative COVID test requirements on entry

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

items.synopsis: The Canberra man led police on a pursuit in May last year, during which he lost the front left tyre of his car. Despite driving on three operational wheels, he reached a speed of 160 kilometres per hour.

title.children: Man who drove at police officer at 120kph on three wheels said he had 'bugger all' meth in his system

image.altText: Nestory Irankunda injury

items.synopsis: A soccer referee who is also a cardiac expert describes the moments in which he rushed to help Adelaide United young gun Nestory Irankunda, who hit his head and appeared to start choking during an alarming on-field incident.

title.children: Referee recounts frantically rushing to aid of A-League star who appeared to be choking on his own tongue

image.altText: A humpback whale about to land on its back with a section of fishing rod in the foreground.

items.synopsis: Two fishers have a tale to tell after a humpback whale broke through the water's surface, drenching them and their small boat in its wake.

title.children: Whale leaves fishers gasping at 'most amazing' sight as it breaches metres from tinnie

image.altText: A black-and-white night-vision photograph, taken from the air, shows a small group of dark figures outside a walled compound.

items.synopsis: As the race for the White House ramps up, threats by Republican candidates to launch military strikes on Mexico's drug cartels are being taken increasingly seriously, sparking concerns on both sides of the border.

title.children: Republicans want to use the military to attack drug cartels in Mexico. Is it just bluster, or could it really happen?

image.altText: A worker next to a hot furnace.

items.synopsis: A Kalgoorlie court has been told one lab worker was left with three times the recommended level of lead in his blood and had to be flown to Perth for treatment.

title.children: WA laboratory fined $30k over lead poisoning of four workers

image.altText: A man in a navy blue suit.

items.synopsis: Lawyers for former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann object to Network Ten's bid to use a psychologist report into the behaviour of sexual assault victims in response to his defamation case.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's lawyers object to Network Ten's bid to use psychologist report as part of defamation case

image.altText: A man smiling wearing a white shirt and black apron.

items.synopsis: A court has found Mr de Pieri misused his position when he tried to tell a potential Mildura council CEO candidate what to say to an interview panel of which the renowned cook was a member.

title.children: Celebrity chef Stefano de Pieri blames 'brain fart' over misuse of position during local government recruitment

image.altText: Picture of man with ear muffs on and glasses, smiling.

items.synopsis: The owner of a Wollongong real estate business has faced court where police allege he plied a teenager with cocaine and alcohol before sexually touching her.

title.children: Real estate agent allegedly recorded himself sexually assaulting teenager, court told

image.altText: Laura Kane (right) pictured holding a football alongside Andrew Dillon.

items.synopsis: Laura Kane describes her pride in becoming the game's most senior football official, an appointment that has been welcomed by the AFL community.

title.children: Laura Kane's appointment as new football boss by AFL seen as groundbreaking moment in Australian sport

image.altText: A man in a blue and yellow polo shirt, superimposed next to an image of a truck crash site

items.synopsis: The 64-year-old driver of another truck died at the scene of the Bruce Highway collision in 2020. Phillip Sturrock has pleaded not guilty over the incident.

title.children: Truck driver hauling 14-tonne pump was texting son before fatal crash, court hears

image.altText: Zhang Jiayi poses for a photograph in the street with her parents.

items.synopsis: With her newly founded clothing company struggling amid China's economic downturn, 31-year-old Zhang Jiayi decided to join the trend of young Chinese adults becoming "full-time children".

title.children: Why young Chinese adults are choosing to become 'full-time children'
